intro: Chorispora pectinata, commonly known as the stickyweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments and it plays a role in local ecosystems.
